page.title: 15PLANT,ROADS & AIRFIELDS
page.content: Engineers how to repair the big machines such as bulldozers and graders. A number of students from foreign countries such as Brunei,Kenya and Jamaica are also taught at PR&A. The Gurkhas are also trained here. During the peak training time from May to the end of July there can be 40 to 50 courses running at any one time. Class sizes vary from 6 to 30+ with the average class size being about 18. There are about 75 teachers at the PR&A most of whom are on a 2 to 2.5 year tour.There are some 300 machines at The PR&A many of which play a multi -purpose role. Their total value is somewhere in the region of 60 million pounds. The machines have a life span of fifteen years. The newest machines which came into servive this year cost about Â£250,000 each.
